bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (20:44): Looking for a way that prevents content highlighting upon rapid page clicking (user-select: none is not a good option in this case)
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (20:45): I guuuuessss I could use setTimeout
3fa179c2d34f53c18e7551ac493014d9 (20:47): haha, a buddy of mine with a nervous habit will not like that
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (20:47): The problem is that, yes, user-select: none removes the visible highlight on that element, but then some other unrelated element receives the selection!
34b0d246331696992e9ee7235f88ca66 (20:47): just preventDefault / stopPropogation on the click?
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (20:50): 34b0d246331696992e9ee7235f88ca66: Nice.  I did not know that would affect selection.  You rock, thanks for the help!
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (20:50): http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ie/archive/2011/11/29/html5-for-applications-the-fourth-ie10-platform-preview.aspx
